professional_identity.name: Amir Khan
professional_identity.title: The Practical Analyst
professional_identity.unique_value_proposition: Bridges 10+ years of operations experience with AI-augmented analytics to solve real business problems
professional_identity.core_differentiator: Lived inside the operational bottlenecks he now solves with data science

contact.status: Open to new opportunities and collaborations

key_strengths.description: 10.5 years managing inventory, forecasting demand, coordinating suppliers. Knows what metrics actually matter because he's lived the operational reality.
108% sales performance (2018), Area Manager promotion, 6-pharmacy purchasing operations within 1 year. Consistently delivers measurable results.
India pharmaceutical sales + UAE retail operations. Deep understanding of customer behavior, supply chains, market dynamics across industries.
No formal CS degree. Self-taught Python, ML, analytics while working full-time. 4 professional certifications. Embodies continuous adaptation.
Uses AI agents as force multipliers. Tool-agnostic approach. Rapid prototyping mindset: MVP → feedback → iteration.

steps.name: Operational Discovery
steps.description: Goes to the floor first. Understands physical processes before touching data. Data without operational context is just noise.

steps.name: AI-Augmented Engineering
steps.description: Defines logic and business rules. Leverages AI agents to generate Python/SQL pipelines. Tool-agnostic, focuses on solving problems, not syntax.

steps.name: Analytical Modeling
steps.description: Moves beyond 'what happened' to 'why' and 'what's next'. Uses Python (Pandas, NumPy) to structure messy data into decision-ready insights.

steps.name: Actionable Delivery
steps.description: Designs for decision-makers, not data scientists. Uses Streamlit, Plotly, Excel depending on audience. Output is clear, visual, tied to business action.

work_methodology.bridge_advantage: Translator between Operations (inventory flow, supplier relations, procurement) and Technology (Python, SQL, ML, automation, dashboards)

highlights: Manages inventory and purchasing for multiple pharmacy outlets
Coordinates with suppliers to optimize procurement cycles
Analyzes ERP data and Excel reports for demand forecasts
Promoted to purchasing role for 6 outlets within 1 year
Handled pharmaceutical purchasing, vendor negotiations, contract management
Maintained stock accuracy and regulatory compliance
Achieved 108% of sales targets in 2018 (top performance tier)
Promoted to Area Business Manager through Level Next leadership program
Built strong healthcare practitioner relationships, drove consistent territory growth

certifications.name: IBM AI Engineering Professional Certificate
certifications.focus: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Neural Networks, AI system architecture

certifications.name: Google Advanced Data Analytics
certifications.focus: End-to-end data analysis, Python, statistical concepts for business

technical_stack.philosophy: Tool-agnostic. Uses AI to adapt instantly. Expertise is in solving problems, not memorizing syntax.

featured_project.name: BlueMart Retail Analytics
featured_project.description: End-to-end retail intelligence system analyzing AED 896.4M in omnichannel revenue across 50 stores
key_insights: Electronics: 46.5% of revenue (AED 416.8M), 30% margins - primary profit driver
Peak: July Summer Sale AED 105.3M (Personal Care +50%, Beverages +40%)
strategic_recommendations: Mobile App: 15% → 20% revenue via app-exclusive flash sales on Electronics
Marketplace: Expand Amazon.ae to 7,500 SKUs (Personal Care, Snacks)
Geographic: 3 new Dubai stores (Marina, JBR, Business Bay) +AED 45M expected
Private Label: 'BlueMart Essentials' in Household - target 45% vs 30% margins

future_focus.next_project: HomeVista - UAE rental market analytics (price prediction, market segmentation)

ideal_collaboration.data_driven_orgs: Faster time-to-insight, practical recommendations, solutions that get implemented
ideal_collaboration.operations_heavy: Speaks both operations and analytics languages, bridges team gaps
ideal_collaboration.growing_companies: Versatile across industries (retail, healthcare, logistics), builds scalable systems, avoids technical debt

guiding_principles: Context is King: Connect data insights to operational reality
Business First, Tech Second: Start with 'what problem' not 'what tools'
AI as Force Multiplier: Accelerate, don't replace strategic thinking
Clear Communication: Translate technical jargon to business language
Scalable Solutions: Build systems that evolve, not technical debt
Measurable Impact: Every analysis ties to concrete business decision/action

good_fit: Has clear business application beyond academic research
Needs operational context to drive technical decisions
poor_fit: Pure academic research with no business application
Requires deep domain expertise in unfamiliar verticals without runway to learn
Requires perfect v1 rather than iterative improvement

communication_preferences.approach: Connect technical decisions to business outcomes
